p: For asthma and COPD exacerbations, identification of pathogens in nasopharyngeal aspirate or Human Rhinovirus (HRV) typing (most common HRV-A and HRV-C) did not affect clinical outcomes except that identification of pathogens in asthma exacerbation was associated with a lower rate of readmissions at 30 and 60â€‰days.
